fields.Title: JOYCE / REALITY TIMES
fields.Description: Times part of hub, solves TASK.reality lowdown

fields.Title: You: ""They're *good* apes, actually.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "They're *good* apes, actually."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "She likes the *totality* of it."
fields.Dialogue Text: She likes the *totality* of it.

fields.Title: You: ""Who got the mineral rights?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who got the mineral rights?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Some were rich enough to stay with..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Some were rich enough to stay with the Constitution; with monarchy -- *big mistake*. Others bet on the Revolution, they were called the Ultras, or ultraliberals. They fared well."

fields.Title: You: ""Rooty tooty pointy shooty!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Rooty tooty pointy shooty!"

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Then *you* happened. Your youth in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Then *you* happened. Your youth in the Thirties.

fields.Title: You: ""Smart king.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Smart king."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, lots of people. Even the king..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, lots of people. Even the king got shot in the head, or thrown beneath a horse. Or drowned. Accounts differ. It was  unceremonious." She shakes her head. "Just as well -- he wasn't actually the king. Just the king's nephew."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Past?" She cocks her head to one s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Past?" She cocks her head to one side. "That's what Dobreva, the leader of the communards said, before she got a bullet in her head. Don't get me wrong..." There's sadness in her voice...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: "Her voice is almost wistful. "We co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Her voice is almost wistful. "We could have had so much *more*. Every one of us -- if only we'd played it right."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""All yours?" She nods. "That's been..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "All yours?" She nods. "That's been the motto of many an indotribe. There is something *clarifying* about that strain of ultraliberalism..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: "She turns to him. "And what is *you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She turns to him. "And what is *your* official position, lieutenant?"

fields.Title: You: ""Wait, you're saying it's been like..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wait, you're saying it's been like this for 43 years?"

fields.Title: You: ""Who started it?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who started it?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""You and everyone else. But that's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You and everyone else. But that's got nothing to do with *preventing* the Revolution. Ah, well... What was was, I guess."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Which one? Actually -- it doesn't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Which one? Actually -- it doesn't matter. King Guillaume has always been my favourite. He could smell a PR disaster brewing. So he got out alive and his nephew Frissel got shot in his place..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""No. I would say the apes were *neu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No. I would say the apes were *neutral*." She looks at you, her gaze sharp.

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops, there is silence on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops, there is silence on the dark water of the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: You: ""Cowardly king.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Cowardly king."

fields.Title: Logic: "For her to be where she is Wild Pin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: For her to be where she is Wild Pines Group must have picked the right side.

fields.Title: You: ""That's it then. Another topic.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's it then. Another topic."

fields.Title: You: ""What did this tzaraath do?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What did this tzaraath do?"

fields.Title: You: ""Probably.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Probably."

fields.Title: You: ""It's been like this for how long,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's been like this for how long, exactly?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The liberals got the mineral right..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The liberals got the mineral rights." She looks up to the sky, then inland at the crumbling city. "And by mineral rights, I mean *everything*."
fields.Alternate1: "The liberals got the mineral rights." She looks up to the sky, then inland at the crumbling village. The wind blows. "And by mineral rights, I mean *everything*."

fields.Title: You: ""How did the liberals win it all?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "How did the liberals win it all?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The liberals took everything that..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The liberals took everything that wasn't nailed to the ground -- the Coalition took the *ground*," she stomps her rubber booted foot. "The ocean, the laws and the people."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The Coalition of Nations. Graad, M..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Coalition of Nations. Graad, Mesque, Vesper, Messina, Oranje and Sur-La-Clef -- the armed centre of the world. They landed here and ended the Revolution. It was the *moralist* thing to do."

fields.Title: You: ""Moralist?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Moralist?"

fields.Title: You: ""Would you say it was a bunch of ap..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Would you say it was a bunch of apes dukin' it out?"

fields.Title: Shivers: "THE AGE OF MAN IS OVER."
fields.Dialogue Text: THE AGE OF MAN IS OVER.

fields.Title: You: ""And after that?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "And after that?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This does not represent the offici..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This does not represent the official RCM opinion," the lieutenant says from behind his notes.

fields.Title: You: ""That's when they discovered Disco.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's when they discovered Disco."

fields.Title: You: ""Until the middle class, the gentry..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Until the middle class, the gentry, and the workers are all gone and the age of man is over."

fields.Title: Empathy: "All she can see are vague outlines..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All she can see are vague outlines of a great winding down. The doldrums. People killed, but no great transitions of wealth. It makes her feel old -- and something else. Something you can't put your finger on...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Good. Not that it would have matte..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good. Not that it would have mattered -- in the end, the Commune forced everyone to the barricades."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Anxious to hear more about mineral..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Anxious to hear more about mineral rights or who got shot in the head?" A flash of teeth in her feisty grin.

fields.Title: Half Light: "Here's some *wisdom* lady. SAY THE..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Here's some *wisdom* lady. SAY THE DEATH THING.

fields.Title: You: ""I would have sought a medical solu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I would have sought a medical solution. Sounds like *tzaraath* drove those people mad."

fields.Title: You: ""At any cost -- until humanity is f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "At any cost -- until humanity is free and the age of Capital is past."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""It wasn't a *who*, but a *what*. A..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It wasn't a *who*, but a *what*. A pandemic of tzaraath, a particularly virulent prion disease, which the authorities in Graad proved unable to contain. Then Mazov came along and overthrew the government."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""I don't know about that..." She tu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know about that..." She turns north, to the bombed out buildings lining the waterfront, then shivers slightly.
fields.Alternate1: "I don't know about that..." She turns east, to the bombed out buildings lining the waterfront, then shivers slightly.

fields.Title: You: ""If everyone got shot, who was ther..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "If everyone got shot, who was there to surrender to?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Indeed. Tzaraath is a highly infec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Indeed. Tzaraath is a highly infectious microorganism that destroyed brain tissue. The actual causes of the Revolution were material. The pandemic only provided the spark."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "It takes time for the apes to chang..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It takes time for the apes to change. And work. Perhaps what happened here was part of that time -- and part of that work.

fields.Title: Composure: "She is not at all fazed by your gen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She is not at all fazed by your genocidal sabre rattling.

fields.Title: You: ""What is the Zone of Control?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What is the Zone of Control?"

fields.Title: You: ""And the apes -- were they evil?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "And the apes -- were they evil?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""I see, yes. A deluge of geopolitic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I see, yes. A deluge of geopolitical questions."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "All that untaxed income must have f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All that untaxed income must have fuelled *The New*. That can only mean one thing...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- the red deluge. The *Insuli..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes -- the red deluge. The *Insulindian Deluge* they call it."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Welcome to reality, baby.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Welcome to reality, baby."

fields.Title: You: ""Happily.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Happily."

fields.Title: You: ""When was this kerfuffle?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "When was this kerfuffle?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""From Revachol and Graad? Not far...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "From Revachol and Graad? Not far. The world managed to cauterize itself. Mazov's government was overthrown in '08, and the Coalition crushed the Revachol commune two years later. It was *The End*."

fields.Title: Shivers: "THERE IS PEACE IN THE HEART."
fields.Dialogue Text: THERE IS PEACE IN THE HEART.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The real king abdicated and lived..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The real king abdicated and lived out a long and productive life as a venture capitalist in Graad."

fields.Title: You: ""Until it's all mine -- every pigme..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Until it's all mine -- every pigment-drenched black leaf of money in Revachol."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""No. It was a market mirage fuelled..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No. It was a market mirage fuelled by cocaine and quantitative easing. The Forties *dispelled* it like a cold splash. An isola-wide hangover, you might say. And here we are..." She curtsies.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, and the anarchists too! They s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, and the anarchists too! They shot them well. So well one forgets they even existed."

fields.Title: You: ""Okay. Maybe it's impossible. What..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay. Maybe it's impossible. What happened had to happen. And always will."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Forty-three years. Hard to fathom,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Forty-three years. Hard to fathom, I know."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""And I asked *you*, philosopher-det..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And I asked *you*, philosopher-detective of the Citizens Militia."

fields.Title: Empathy: "There is bitterness in her voice --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There is bitterness in her voice -- tempered with understanding. She is critical, but ultimately understands the cause.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Now's your chance -- ask her who sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Now's your chance -- ask her who she is -- she won't get out this time.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Then you would have died fighting..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then you would have died fighting against them. Long before the Beachhead... our time is a shadow cast by that day."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""On the other hand..." She turns no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "On the other hand..." She turns north, to the bombed out buildings lining the waterfront. "Maybe you're right."
fields.Alternate1: "On the other hand..." She turns east, to the bombed out buildings lining the waterfront. "Maybe you're right."

fields.Title: Half Light: "A quietly simmering rage."
fields.Dialogue Text: A quietly simmering rage.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Good hygiene, really? A very *mode..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good hygiene, really? A very *moderate* solution to an *extreme* problem. It's those sort of half-measures that doomed the authorities in Graad..."

fields.Title: You: ""With some hygiene, modest social c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "With some hygiene, modest social care and perhaps a little research program."

fields.Title: You: ""They got lucky.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "They got lucky."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Good question." She cranes her nec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good question." She cranes her neck: "What would *you* have done differently?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Why, you and I, officer--" She spr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why, you and I, officer--" She spreads her arms, raincoat flapping in the wind. "Our lives in the Zone of Control."

fields.Title: You: ""Who are the Coalition?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who are the Coalition?"

fields.Title: You: ""Truly a *kerfuffle*.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Truly a *kerfuffle*."

fields.Title: You: ""Anyone else get shot in the head -..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Anyone else get shot in the head -- on the opposing side?"

fields.Title: Shivers: "REVACHOL FOREVER."
fields.Dialogue Text: REVACHOL FOREVER.

fields.Title: Empathy: "From the looks of it the Fifties ha..."
fields.Dialogue Text: From the looks of it the Fifties haven't been much better for the Zone of Control -- you can see it in her eyes. Days slipping away....

fields.Title: You: "Say nothing."
fields.Dialogue Text: Say nothing.

fields.Title: Shivers: "The cold runs down your spine -- sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The cold runs down your spine -- she gestures toward the waters.

fields.Title: Empathy: "She's not gloating. It's a relieved..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She's not gloating. It's a relieved celebration.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""It made people overthrow their gov..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It made people overthrow their governments."

fields.Title: You: ""They chose wisely.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "They chose wisely."

fields.Title: You: ""I asked you -- who are you in all..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I asked you -- who are you in all this?"

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The cold dissipates into your parietal lobe like a dissolved bullet. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""They didn't *win* so much as survi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They didn't *win* so much as survive. *We* were the last ones standing when the war ended -- everyone else got shot in the head, remember?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The moralists believe in keeping e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The moralists believe in keeping everything exactly the way it is. They believe in mineral rights -- and not shooting people in the head..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""At least not in the same *manner a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "At least not in the same *manner and volume* as the others do. They are the long-standing provisional rulers of Revachol now -- the Coalition Government."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""This is their Zone of Control. The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This is their Zone of Control. They embolden the RCM with crumbs of the same law they took. Technically speaking -- *you* are a moralist."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""A devout man of the centre," she n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A devout man of the centre," she nods. "Hard to come by. It's good to have someone who takes a moderate approach to head-shooting -- in your line of work I mean."

fields.Title: Half Light: "The apes will never change, they ar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The apes will never change, they are all evil. End of discussion.

fields.Title: Shivers: "POCKMARKED BY CANNONS."
fields.Dialogue Text: POCKMARKED BY CANNONS.

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks and a gunshot echoes of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks and a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: You: ""You don't seem to be thrilled...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "You don't seem to be thrilled..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Then you would have died, most lik..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then you would have died, most likely. Not far from here -- maybe even *right* here, during the Beachhead, defending the coast the day the Coalition took the city."

fields.Title: You: ""Which side was Wild Pines Group on?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Which side was Wild Pines Group on?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Modernity. They developed the marv..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Modernity. They developed the marvels of interisolary communication, telematic milieus, radiation, coloured plastics. Meanwhile, in Revachol West, the *aftermath* continues for the fifth decade."

fields.Title: You: ""Wow, really?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wow, really?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Liquidate?" She nods. "That's what..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Liquidate?" She nods. "That's what King Filippe kept screaming from the Sol Aurum. *Liquidate, liquidate!*" she says in a sing-song-y kind of way.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Kim Kitsuragi: ""Khm." The lieutenant puts down his..."]
Joyce Messier: ""Coupris, Resplendent... both gone..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Coupris, Resplendent... both gone now. Those that survived mended their ways. They're all *ultras* now."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "The colour of moralism is blue. The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The colour of moralism is blue. The official motto of the Moralintern, or Moralist International, is: 'A blue forget-me-not; a piece of the grey sky'. Unofficial: 'For a moment, there was hope'.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""An almost endearingly moralist sta..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "An almost endearingly moralist standpoint," she bows. "It must be hard to take a moderate approach to head-shooting in your line of work."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Don't worry, Kras Mazov shot fifte..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't worry, Kras Mazov shot fifteen million people in the head. But that was all the way over in Graad."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. And quantitative easing. It w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. And quantitative easing. It was a market mirage, unfortunately. The Forties dispelled it. An isola-wide hangover, you might say. So, here we are..." She curtsies.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Something tells you her life and yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Something tells you her life and yours are not that similar. Maybe it's because she has a boat and you have... that necktie? A pair of pants?

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Capital *is* finished. But underst..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Capital *is* finished. But understand this -- its end won't *free* anyone. It will only lead to more suffering."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The Turn-of-the-Century Revolution..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Turn-of-the-Century Revolution?" She smiles, mischievously. "Don't answer it -- it's a trick question."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""I would have sided with the *canno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I would have sided with the *cannons*. If you'd seen the calibres of the things, you might've, too... " She thinks. "Perhaps it's better I was born when I was..."

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The cold dissipates into your parietal lobe like a dissolved bullet. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Understandable," she nods."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Understandable," she nods.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Did they ever. Before they got sho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did they ever. Before they got shot themselves, they shot two million people."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""To foreign intervention -- the Coa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "To foreign intervention -- the Coalition. Those people *really* took the mineral rights."

fields.Title: You: ""I don't think I am moralist, ma'am.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't think I am moralist, ma'am."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or -- you could *not* eat all the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Or -- you could *not* eat all the candy at once, let the ma'am rest for a while, and return to this later?"

fields.Title: You: ""I don't care about kings. Tell me..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't care about kings. Tell me one more thing..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, King Guillaume had a nose for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, King Guillaume had a nose for bad PR. He ran before it -- what is the expression -- *went down*? Anyway, Gil got out alive and his nephew Frissel got shot in his place..."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Not so fast -- who is she in all th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not so fast -- who is she in all this? Ask her who she is, she owes you an answer.

fields.Title: You: ""What would you have done different..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What would you have done differently?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""And I asked *you*, past-less detec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And I asked *you*, past-less detective of the Citizens Militia. What insight has acute encephalopathy given to you?"
fields.Alternate1: "And I asked *you*, past-less detective of the Citizens Militia. What insight has acute encephalopathy given to you?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Welcome to reality, baby.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Welcome to reality, baby."

fields.Title: Suggestion: "A counterargument, but still -- you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A counterargument, but still -- your historic mass-murderer fantasies have only endeared you to this person.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Why of course -- we're talking duk..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why of course -- we're talking duke-out central. Full-swing intraspecies warfare."

fields.Title: Shivers: "IT'S ALL YOURS."
fields.Dialogue Text: IT'S ALL YOURS.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""I've no right to be dissatisfied,"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I've no right to be dissatisfied," she shakes her head. "This shirt is Barbara Muskova. This raincoat is impervious to rain and is guaranteed for a hundred years, my daughters will wear it. No, it's just..." She looks at the crumbling tenements, paint flecking from the stone...
fields.Alternate1: "I've no right to be dissatisfied," she shakes her head. "This shirt is Barbara Muskova. This raincoat is impervious to rain and is guaranteed for a hundred years, my daughters will wear it..." She looks at the eternite roofs and cinder blocks soaking in the sea air.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Believe it or not, Wild Pines isn'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Believe it or not, Wild Pines isn't even the most notorious example -- that would be Saint-Baptiste. You can go quite far with that attitude."

fields.Title: Half Light: "Your jaw clenches -- give the lady..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your jaw clenches -- give the lady a taste of your *wisdom*.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My position, ma'am? My parents got..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "My position, ma'am? My parents got ripped to shreds in the Revolution -- I would have gone the same way. I was saved by being two years old. That's my position -- the abattoir."

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The cold dissipates into your parietal lobe like a dissolved bullet. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Volition: "No -- her first."
fields.Dialogue Text: No -- her first.

fields.Title: You: ""Until this insanity is crushed and..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Until this insanity is crushed and Revachol reigns -- a suzerain forever."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""In the end they liquidated the Sol..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "In the end they liquidated the Sol Aurum. Melted the palace cube down to gold and platinum and sold it for bullets. Strange times," she says almost wistfully.

fields.Title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Rooty-tooty pointy shooty!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Rooty-tooty pointy shooty!

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "The rulers of Revachol -- and also..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The rulers of Revachol -- and also *the world*. These guys are strong.

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The charge dissipates into the dark water. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: You: ""Sounds like evil to me.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sounds like evil to me."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Him and tens of thousands of his *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Him and tens of thousands of his *wonderfully* fascist kingsmen. It was a *wild* time."

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops, there is silence on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops, there is silence on the dark water of the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""So a quarter of humanity..." she c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "So a quarter of humanity..." she calculates, "...simply lost their minds? And how would you stop a prion -- a complex folding protein; *un-life* -- with the technology 50 years ago?"

fields.Title: You: ""Our lives are not the same.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Our lives are not the same."
fields.Alternate1: "Our lives are very different from each other."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""No doubt -- but we share the same..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No doubt -- but we share the same time and position on the planet's crust. That counts for more than you'd think."

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The charge dissipates into the dark water. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The cold dissipates into your parietal lobe like a dissolved bullet. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Liberals are usually middle-class..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Liberals are usually middle-class people, detective. Or the remaining gentry. The beneficiaries of the pre-revolutionary *arrangement*."

fields.Title: You: ""Not just technically -- practicall..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Not just technically -- practically as well. I like what I've heard about these people."
fields.Alternate1: "Not just technically -- practically. For a moment, there was hope."

fields.Title: You: ""No. More. NOW.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "No. More. NOW."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""About head-shooting?" She smiles."
fields.Dialogue Text: "About head-shooting?" She smiles.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Forever?" She cocks her head sidew..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Forever?" She cocks her head sideways. "In twenty years Revachol went from a king to a commune to a Zone of Control. She *is* forever. But the next thing she will *be* is something else."

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The charge dissipates into the dark water. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Over?" She nods. "That's *entropol..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Over?" She nods. "That's *entropolism*, the very height of late Modernity: evacuate this world. You may prove a truly Modern Man yet."

fields.Title: You: ""That's enough about the times.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's enough about the times."

fields.Title: You: ""Who got shot in the head?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who got shot in the head?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""A poor remedy for prion disease,"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A poor remedy for prion disease," she says. "That was the attitude of most of the more moderate indotribes, particularly those who supported the king..."

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops and for a moment the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops and for a moment there's silence. The charge dissipates into the dark water. All is quiet on the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Always," She nods. "That's the *ca..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Always," She nods. "That's the *can't-do-attitude* that truly defines Late Modernity. You may prove a Modern Man yet."

fields.Title: You: ""What happened in the rest of the w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What happened in the rest of the world?" (Proceed.)

fields.Title: You: ""Later, yes. Let my mind cool a bit.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Later, yes. Let my mind cool a bit."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The Zone of Control is the third i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Zone of Control is the third incarnation of Revachol. After the failure of the Suzerain and the Commune."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: Shivers: "CAPITAL IS PAST."
fields.Dialogue Text: CAPITAL IS PAST.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The Twenties saw a decade of urban..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Twenties saw a decade of urban war: West of the river levelled, offshore platforms in flames... Still, it's regarded as an improvement on what came before: '08 to '19 was simply hell..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The Thirties? Things settled down..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Thirties? Things settled down in the Thirties. Revachol East transformed itself into the world's largest tax haven -- with the international community's blessing. For the first time in a long time it seemed like things were *going* somewhere."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Those would be the communists. Gen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Those would be the communists. Generally speaking, 40 million people got shot in the head during the World Revolution. But the communists -- they *all* got shot in the head."

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "It was a funny time in history. The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It was a funny time in history. They'd discovered transistors and rock music, but they didn't know anything about prions. Nobody did.

fields.Title: Shivers: "The cold runs down your spine as yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The cold runs down your spine as you say the words, like a small electric charge that seeks grounding.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Perhaps it wouldn't have turned ou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Perhaps it wouldn't have turned out that way had *I* been in charge. I might've bet on the king and led the Pines to doom."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Ten of the fourteen indotribes got..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ten of the fourteen indotribes got it wrong: Feld, Coupris, Tricentennial... So I suppose I would have been in good company."

fields.Title: You: ""I would have killed more -- 400 mi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I would have killed more -- 400 million -- if that's what it took."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""I see -- a tenth of humanity." She..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I see -- a tenth of humanity." She's unfazed. "The key of History is in the lock -- keep turning, at any cost?"

fields.Title: You: ""Okay, and by *liberals* you mean...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, and by *liberals* you mean..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Voracious," she nods approvingly...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Voracious," she nods approvingly. "I'm up for it. What'll it be?"

fields.Title: You: ""Sounds like they should have shot..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sounds like they should have shot more people in the head then."

fields.Title: You: ""Liquidate the rabid, prion-infeste..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Liquidate the rabid, prion-infested *dogs* who want to kill everyone -- with cleansing artillery fire."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""A city state divided into free mar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A city state divided into free market zones. Under the *everlasting* interregnum of the Coalition of Nations. And you, of course -- the Citizens Militia."

fields.Title: Shivers: "ALWAYS."
fields.Dialogue Text: ALWAYS.

fields.Title: You: ""Wait. You just said the liberals a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wait. You just said the liberals already took everything."

fields.Title: You: ""If always picking the option that..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "If always picking the option that doesn't commit to anything then hell yes I am -- and also not."

fields.Title: You: "(Cock your finger pistols.) "Rooty..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Cock your finger pistols.) "Rooty tooty pointy shooty!"

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, an acute thiamine deficiency..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, an acute thiamine deficiency can be exacerbated by alcoholism." She blinks her green eyes. "Exacerbated means 'made worse.'"

fields.Title: You: ""With privatized healthcare and a w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "With privatized healthcare and a work ethic that does not turn your brain into sponge tissue."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: You: ""Coupris is still around, aren't th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Coupris is still around, aren't they?"

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know what I would have don..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know what I would have done differently."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Time flies.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Time flies."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""They are what they are -- who know..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They are what they are -- who knows, an afterbloom may yet come..."

fields.Title: You: ""You would have sided with the king?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "You would have sided with the king?"

fields.Title: You: ""Okay -- neutral.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay -- neutral."

fields.Title: You: ""No way. I wouldn't have fought wit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No way. I wouldn't have fought with the communards."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""I prefer the term *risk averse*. K..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I prefer the term *risk averse*. King Guillaume was nobody's fool -- he could smell a PR disaster brewing. So he got out alive and his nephew Frissel got shot in his place..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""That's not Coupris, dear. It's jus..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's not Coupris, dear. It's just a brand name, snatched up by a Vespertine holding company. No, the real Coupris is as dead as the king they bet on."

fields.Title: Suggestion: "There is curiosity there that goes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There is curiosity there that goes unnoticed. The lieutenant takes a step back, absent-mindedly.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "She narrows her eyes -- turning her..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She narrows her eyes -- turning her gaze to the future out of professional habit...

fields.Title: You: ""Did the communists and the anarchi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did the communists and the anarchists shoot back?"

fields.Title: You: ""You could say they got *totally* s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You could say they got *totally* shot in the head."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "We -- she's one of them. Of course."
fields.Dialogue Text: We -- she's one of them. Of course.

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: You: ""I had a deluge too. In my head." (..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I had a deluge too. In my head." (Point to your little head.)

fields.Title: You: ""Were they?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Were they?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Khm." The lieutenant puts down his..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Khm." The lieutenant puts down his notes for a moment. "Opinions expressed here do not reflect the official position of the RCM."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: "She's silent a moment, contemplatin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She's silent a moment, contemplating. When she finally speaks, her tone is wistful: "We could have had so much *more*. Every one of us -- if only we'd played it right."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course not. It was a highly inf..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course not. It was a highly infectious microorganism that destroyed brain tissue. The actual causes of the Revolution were material. The pandemic only provided the spark."

fields.Title: Shivers: "A cold creeps up your spine, reachi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A cold creeps up your spine, reaching its tendrils up your neck, toward the back of your head...

fields.Title: Shivers: "The wind stops, there is silence on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind stops, there is silence on the dark water of the Martinaise inlet...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""No -- almost certainly. The Commun..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No -- almost certainly. The Commune would have forced you. Such was the fate of the undecided."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""They picked the winning side. That..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They picked the winning side. That's why they're here and others are not."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""The Revolution began in '02, on th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Revolution began in '02, on the isola of Graad, though by the end nearly the whole world had gotten involved."

fields.Title: You: ""I would have made off with the min..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I would have made off with the mineral rights."
fields.Alternate1: "I would have positioned myself very precisely. I would have made it out -- with the mineral rights."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""When they failed to step up, Mazov..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "When they failed to step up, Mazov and his party stepped in. In this *particular* case, maybe a more robust state response might have been appropriate..."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Indeed. They piled them in mass gr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Indeed. They piled them in mass graves in Ozonne and, well -- that's the last anyone heard of those people."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course," she sizes you up. "Not..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course," she sizes you up. "Not easy to be moderate about *head-shooting* in your line of work."

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Too much *reality* at once can pro..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Too much *reality* at once can prove too much," she nods. "There's plenty of time later. For now, is there anything *else* I can help you with?"

fields.Title: Empathy: "No. The tiny apes are doing all the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. The tiny apes are doing all they can to be better. It's not their fault.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""On the other hand..." She turns no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "On the other hand..." She turns north, to the bombed out buildings lining the waterfront, then shivers slightly.
fields.Alternate1: "On the other hand..." She turns east, to the bombed out buildings lining the waterfront, then shivers slightly.

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. The *Insulindian Deluge* they..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. The *Insulindian Deluge* they call it."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building.

fields.Title: You: ""What have we been doing all that t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What have we been doing all that time?"

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "The clatter of typewriter keys fill..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The clatter of typewriter keys fills the main hall of a re-appropriated Silk Mill -- Precinct 41. Chad Tillbrook presses ENTER. Outside: Officer *Elfboy* Williams slams the door of an armoured motor carriage...

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Something tells you her life and yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Something tells you her life and yours are not that similar.

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""Anyway, enough sentimentality. Is..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Anyway, enough sentimentality. Is there anything else you want to know?"

fields.Title: Joyce Messier: ""That's the way of History." She no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's the way of History." She nods.

fields.Title: You: ""I *loved* that king. Fucking commu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I *loved* that king. Fucking communists..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was a kerfuffle all right," the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was a kerfuffle all right," the lieutenant mumbles from behind his notes.

fields.Title: Shivers: "IT'S ALL YOURS."
fields.Dialogue Text: IT'S ALL YOURS.

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building. A woman's voice...

fields.Title: You: ""That's a tragedy.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's a tragedy."

fields.Title: You: ""No way.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "No way."

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dog barks, a gunshot echoes off the walls of some distant building.

fields.Title: You: ""Where did it spread from there?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Where did it spread from there?"

fields.Title: You: ""What came next?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What came next?"
